intro: Rhaponticoides hajastana, commonly known as the Hajastan rhapontic, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for taxonomic study and ecological research. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
